poem:
###  
The Secret Exchange

In corridors of whispers  
policy breathes life to  
quiet ties—  
bloodless veins  
of a nation's pulse.  
Rules unfold, thin as air  
yet heavy with the weight  
of ordinary faces  
unseen, unsung—  
woven shadows  
reverberate, even in  
these fractured times.  
Through unmarked  
meetings,  
the world is remade.
